content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on an incut jug and then up the curving arete to an easy topout. A little grainy but it should clean up with more traffic.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Directly opposite

Buckskin

on a seperate boulder.

on the backside of the Little Big Horn boulder is a slab. The right side is probably VB or V0-.

The left side is a little harder, but still probably no harder than V0

content.description:
Climbs the nice slab right of Burning Sensation using friction and some good edges/flakes. Easy downclimb on the backside.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Right side of the west face between Burning Sensation and

Medicine Man

.

content.description: Climb up small edges to gain the right facing flake.   From here finish direct.
content.location:
Center of the wall, just to the left of

Burning Sensation

.

content.description: Sit start underneath the boulder in the same place as for Sitting Bull. Instead of going left as for Sitting Bull, go right to a high sidepull, then up.
content.location: To the left of Little Bighorn. Start on the obvious cracked patina holds near the ground at the low roof.

content.description:
Short Sharp Shock.

Sit start underneath the boulder.   Feet up, hands up, reach out to good crimps.   Bust out from the underside and make hard pulls on crimps and sidepulls until the incut lip of the boulder is reached.

Mantle the obvious flake right of

Sun Dance

and continue up the easy slab above. An easy downclimb exists on the backside of the boulder.

* This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Far right side of the west face.

content.description:
Steep jug hauling.

Climb the very steep left arete of the North West face.
content.location: Left arete of the NW face.

content.description: Start sit start on the low uneven crimps to the left and make a big first move to a bad right hand crimp. Work up and right on the flakes and patina and top out where the two boulders meet. Stand start on head high crimps could go at v4.
content.location: South west side of the Boulder in the small cubby.

content.description:
Pop or lunge?   That is the question.

Bit of a one move wonder, but worth the entertainment.

Step on and grab the crimps.   Now make your way to the good hold in the middle of the slab.   From here finish straight up.
content.location: Right of center on the North West face.

content.description:
Tunnel under past

Sitting Bull

(V4) and sit start off the obvious block with hands at the lowest possible start. One move to good holds then follow the incut plates to the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
East face of the boulder and about 10 feet left of

Sitting Bull

.
